alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 9:06PM MDT until August 21 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, Roosevelt. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 903 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly east from northern Chaves County into Roosevelt County. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen along U.S. 70 between Elkins and Kenna. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elida and Kenna. - Railroad Mountain Road, Olive Road, Lovington Road, Elida Road, San Patricio Road, Bojax Road, and Tinnie Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
